result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Sagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Total Restitution: $6,900.00.  Defendant has paid $4,500.00 upfront.  Balance of $2,400.00 to be paid as a condition of probation and to be paid before all costs/fines for:
Western Raquet Club

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge/Sample are WAIVED based on date of violation.

No contact with: Western Raquet Club or Timon C.
Follow thorugh with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Jury trial - 12 person on February 7, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Matthew L Sagen in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests an adjournment of the trial to allow additional time for the Defendant to continue to pay upfront restitution within 60 to 90 days. The State does not object.  The Court grants the request and adjourns the trial for 60 days and reschedules the trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Matthew L Sagen in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court grants the request and reschedules the trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 08:15 am.
